title: [Bug] Not all versions get listed as options for virtual dependencies
body:
@tgamblin 

I'm looking at the `candidates` variable inside `concretize.py`:`DefaultConcretizer`:`_valid_virtuals_and_externals()`.  I'm printing this out, and noticed that the list of candidates it shows is quite truncated, compared to the list of versions a package provides.  For example, I'm getting the following list:

```
candidates [openmpi@1.10.0, openmpi@2.0.0, mpich@1:, mpich@3:, intel-parallel-studio@cluster:+mpi, mvapich2@2.0:, mvapich2@1.9]
```

That is in spite of the following declarations in `openmpi/package.py`:

```
    version('2.0.0', 'cdacc800cb4ce690c1f1273cb6366674')
    version('1.10.3', 'e2fe4513200e2aaa1500b762342c674b')
    version('1.10.2', 'b2f43d9635d2d52826e5ef9feb97fd4c')
    version('1.10.1', 'f0fcd77ed345b7eafb431968124ba16e')
    version('1.10.0', '280cf952de68369cebaca886c5ce0304')
    version('1.8.8', '0dab8e602372da1425e9242ae37faf8c')
    version('1.6.5', '03aed2a4aa4d0b27196962a2a65fc475')

    provides('mpi@3.1', when='@2.0.0')
    provides('mpi@3.0', when='@1.10.3')
    provides('mpi@3.0', when='@1.10.2')
    provides('mpi@3.0', when='@1.10.1')
    provides('mpi@3.0', when='@1.10.0')
#    provides('mpi@3.0', when='@1.8.8')
#    provides('mpi@2.2', when='@1.6.5')
```

The workaround for now is to comment out versions in `packages.py` that I don't want.  But does anyone have a more serious fix?
